lead_paragraph: The Dubai Holding Commercial Operations Group, a real-estate and hospitality company owned by the emirate's ruler, reported a full-year loss of 22.8 billion dirhams ($6.2 billion) after property prices plunged in the Gulf's trade and tourism hub, Bloomberg News reported.
